title: Dog Care Fundamentals
description: Dogs are loyal companions that bring immense joy and require a significant commitment. Responsible dog ownership involves dedication to their training, health, and daily exercise needs.
sentences: Choose a high-quality dog food that is appropriate for their age, breed, and activity level.
Daily walks and playtime are essential for their physical and mental well-being.
Start basic obedience training (sit, stay, come) early using positive reinforcement techniques.
Socialize your puppy from a young age with different people, sounds, and other vaccinated dogs.
Regular vet visits for vaccinations, parasite control (ticks, fleas, worms), and health check-ups are vital.
dos: Provide consistent rules, boundaries, and routines to make your dog feel secure.
Groom them regularly, which includes brushing their coat, nail trimming, and occasional bathing.
Provide safe chew toys to prevent destructive chewing and promote dental health.
Always keep them on a leash in public areas for their safety and the safety of others.
donts: Don't leave a dog unattended in a parked car, as temperatures can rise to fatal levels very quickly.
Don't feed them toxic foods like chocolate, grapes, raisins, or onions.
Don't punish them for accidents in the house; focus on a consistent potty training schedule.
Don't skip their daily exercise; a tired dog is a happy and well-behaved dog.
